Attacking #SNAP is not a solution to our nation's challenges. 

Instead, let's focus on comprehensive policies that address the root causes of poverty, such as affordable housing, access to education, & job training. 

#DefendSNAP

Our kids can’t learn if they're hungry. 

Restricting SNAP would make it harder for struggling parents to feed their children. 

We must #DefendSNAP because hindering it is counterproductive to a child's ability to learn & their overall health. It's one piece of a larger puzzle.

Increasing work requirements for #SNAP may sound appealing to Republicans, but let's consider the consequences... 

It would leave many vulnerable individuals & families without access to food assistance, exacerbating food insecurity and compromising their well-being. #DefendSNAP

Let's debunk the myth that #SNAP recipients are lazy. A majority of recipients work but still struggle to make ends meet!

SNAP helps bridge the gap between low wages & the cost of living, ensuring hard working Americans can put food on the table for their families. #DefendSNAP

By providing access to food, SNAP helps millions of Americans focus on their education, work and other pathways to self-sufficiency.

So let's stop calling it a 'handout.'

SNAP is an investment in America's potential. And we need to protect it.

SNAP helps more than 45,000 folks in #OR06 put nutritious food on the table.

It supports people from all walks of life:

Workers.
Veterans.
Seniors.
Farmers.
Students.
Parents.
Siblings.
Neighbors.
Friends.

We can't let them go hungry. We must #DefendSNAP.

Access to safe contraception is a no-brainer in our fight to defend reproductive freedom — and we must protect it.

Congress needs to codify into federal law the right to contraception. It’s what Americans want.

In his concurring opinion overturning Roe v. Wade, Justice Thomas argued that SCOTUS should reconsider Griswold, among other landmark decisions.

We can't sit back as more and more constitutional protections get wiped away by this court.

Today in 1965 the Supreme Court handed down its decision in Griswold v. Connecticut, striking down bans on contraception and affirming Americans’ right to privacy.

Today the overwhelming majority of Americans support access to contraception, but that right is still at risk.

Expanding SNAP eligibility has a proven track record of lifting families out of poverty, improving health outcomes, & making communities stronger.

No one in the U.S. should ever go hungry. SNAP is a supplemental assistance program designed to provide a safety net for those facing economic hardships. SNAP helps individuals and families get back on their feet and contribute to society.
Research shows that 4 out of 5 households in the SNAP program has at least 1 working adult. We should be streamlining and improving access to SNAP, not making it more difficult for those in need.
In Connecticut, 138,800 children receive SNAP benefits. I’ll always fight to protect this vital program and ensure no kid has to worry about where their next meal will come from.
$6 a day per person is not the source of the national debt. SNAP is most effective anti hunger program to connect the most vulnerable to nutritious foods and prevent chronic disease.

6 months into the 118th Congress & the Ag Committee has finally held its first & unfortunately, likely its only hearing on nutrition.

With 15.3M children relying on SNAP each month, nutrition programs must be prioritized & strengthened - not cut back. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/FyCLJF2WYAYKVlI.jpg https://video.twimg.com/amplify_video/1666484682748223493/vid/480x270/10KMLmwBHzHF1IqK.mp4?tag=16

SNAP is more than a lifeline for individuals and families; it also benefits local economies.
